meanings.definition: Make or declare (something, typically a church) sacred for religious use.
meanings.sent1: The priest is consecrating the new church with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The bishop consecrated the holy water before the service.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels consecrated the tree as their secret meeting spot.
meanings.sent4: The artist consecrated the canvas with vibrant colors and bold strokes.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual of consecrating the temple was filled with solemnity and reverence.

meanings.definition: Devote (something) exclusively to a particular purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: She is consecrating all her time to studying for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The chef consecrated the entire day to perfecting his signature dish.
meanings.sent3: The cat consecrated the sunny spot on the windowsill as her own.
meanings.sent4: The author consecrated his latest book to his loyal readers.
meanings.sent5: The team consecrated their efforts to winning the championship, practicing tirelessly every day.
